channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Kansas Supreme Court rules against strict abortion laws amidst an influx of patients
item.description: The Kansas Supreme Court ruled against two anti-abortion laws, suggesting other restrictions could fall. The state has received numerous patients from states with tighter laws.
item.content:encoded: The Kansas Supreme Court ruled against two anti-abortion laws, suggesting other restrictions could fall. The state has received numerous patients from states with tighter laws.
item.dc:creator: Rose Conlon

item.title: Week in politics: Biden tries to do debate damage control with ABC interview
item.description: President Biden gave an exclusive interview to ABC News Friday and tried to calm voters concerned about whether he should run for another term. We'll discuss how he did.
item.content:encoded: President Biden gave an exclusive interview to ABC News Friday and tried to calm voters concerned about whether he should run for another term. We'll discuss how he did.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Saturday Sports: Copa America and the U.S. men's soccer team, criminal probe into doping
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon and ESPN's Michele Steele discuss the US men's soccer team's flameout at Copa America and a criminal probe into doping.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon and ESPN's Michele Steele discuss the US men's soccer team's flameout at Copa America and a criminal probe into doping.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: California tried to fix a major Medicare loophole for seniors
item.description: Seniors choosing Medicare Advantage plans for the first time often don't realize they might get locked out of traditional Medicare for good. But changing this problem must be done state by state.
item.content:encoded: Seniors choosing Medicare Advantage plans for the first time often don't realize they might get locked out of traditional Medicare for good. But changing this problem must be done state by state.
item.dc:creator: Kate Wolffe

item.title: In Philadelphia, a run club helps those recovering from addiction find purpose
item.description: Kellen Matthews-Thompson says in early addiction recovery, you need to “change people, places and things." His Recovery Run Club is designed to help people when they are at their most vulnerable.
item.content:encoded: Kellen Matthews-Thompson says in early addiction recovery, you need to “change people, places and things." His Recovery Run Club is designed to help people when they are at their most vulnerable.
item.dc:creator: Buffy Gorrilla

item.title: Voters in France will cast their ballots in a run-off election
item.description: Voters in France cast ballots Sunday in a runoff election between a far-right party and a coalition of moderate and centrist parties.
item.content:encoded: Voters in France cast ballots Sunday in a runoff election between a far-right party and a coalition of moderate and centrist parties.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Right wing movements are growing in Europe. How do they differ from those in the U.S.?
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon asks historian and Atlantic magazine writer Anne Applebaum how different right-wing movements are in Europe and in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon asks historian and Atlantic magazine writer Anne Applebaum how different right-wing movements are in Europe and in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: U.K.'s Conservative Party suffered its worst-ever defeat. What went wrong?
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon talks with Robert Shrimsley of the Financial Times about the election in the UK, when the incumbent Conservative Party lost badly.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon talks with Robert Shrimsley of the Financial Times about the election in the UK, when the incumbent Conservative Party lost badly.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Veterans remember their time in disaster relief operations
item.description: As part of our StoryCorps Military Voices Initiative, we hear from two veterans who volunteer with disaster relief operations, Michael Davidson and Windy Barton.
item.content:encoded: As part of our StoryCorps Military Voices Initiative, we hear from two veterans who volunteer with disaster relief operations, Michael Davidson and Windy Barton.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: A Chicago rabbi was a committed advocate for gun safety. A recent attack changed that
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Rabbi Tamar Manasseh about a recent shooting right outside a community center she set up on Chicago's South Side, and her fear for the safety of the children who use it.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Rabbi Tamar Manasseh about a recent shooting right outside a community center she set up on Chicago's South Side, and her fear for the safety of the children who use it.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
